It has fared better in gardens than most other Baby's Breath, growing to a height of up to 4 feet and blooming throughout the summer months. Its mounding habit and airy inflorescence also make it an excellent filler for flowerbeds. The plant is easy to care for and drought tolerant, requiring little maintenance. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3358,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"French honeysuckle","description":"French honeysuckle (Hedysarum coronarium) is a unique climbing plant with vibrant yellow blooms. Growing up to 8 feet tall, it has bi-pinnate leaves and produces fragrant, tubular flowers. These flowers attract a variety of wildlife including bees, hummingbirds, and butterflies. It is a drought-tolerant species that is hardy to USDA zones 3-9 and is low maintenance, requiring just an occasional pruning and fertilizing. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3360,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"sneezeweed","description":"Sneezeweed (Helenium amarum) is a flowering herb native to North America. It blossoms in midsummer, producing numerous tiny, yellow flowers. The flowers have cup-shaped petals with bright yellow centers. It grows tall, up to 2 meters high, and has long, lance-shaped, rough leaves. Its common name is derived from the peppery smell the flowers exude when bruised. The flower heads are used to create a variety of dyes and in sneezing powder used in Native American ceremonies. This fast-growing perennial also makes an attractive addition to gardens, offering a burst of bright yellow color throughout the summer months.","family":"Asteraceae","flower_color":"Yellow","flowering_season":null,"fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"Low","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":["green"],"maintenance":"Low","origin":["United States"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Division","Root Cutting","Seed Propagation","Layering Propagation"],"pruning_month":["March","April","May","June","July","August","September","March","April","May"],"scientific_name":["Helenium amarum"],"soil":[],"watering_period":null}}

{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3359,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"shrubby yellowcrest","description":"Shrubby yellowcrest (Heimia salicifolia) is a small shrub native to North and Central America. Its scientific name is derived from its small yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring and summer. The leaves of the shrubby yellowcrest are oval-shaped and emerald green. As the plant matures, it produces small bright yellow flowers growing in clusters on the tips of the branches. Shrubby yellowcrest prefers full sunlight and warm temperatures and is tolerant of drought conditions. Its flowers are attractive to many pollinators, including bees, hummingbirds and butterflies. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3361,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"sneezeweed","description":"Sneezeweed (Helenium autumnale) is an herbaceous perennial that produces bright yellow flowers in the late summer. This North American native plant typically grows to a height of 1 1/2 to 3 feet (45cm-90cm), thrives in moist, slightly acidic soil, and attracts bees, butterflies, and other pollinators. Its blooms last from August to October and can be used for cut flower arrangements. The plant is aptly named as its leaves can cause a reaction when crushed, similar to sneezing. In addition, the leaves of sneezeweed contain coumarin, and it was once used to treat colds.","family":"Asteraceae","flower_color":"Yellow rays and dull yellow center disks","flowering_season":null,"fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"Low","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":["red","yellow","orange"],"maintenance":"Moderate","origin":["North America"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Division","Root Cutting","Seed Propagation","Layering Propagation"],"pruning_month":["February","March","April","March","April","May","June","July","August","September"],"scientific_name":["Helenium autumnale"],"soil":["Loamy Clay Humus"],"watering_period":null}}

{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3368,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"sneezeweed","description":"Helenium 'Helbro' MARDI GRAS, or Sneezeeweed, is an attractive perennial with bronze, daisy-like flowers. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3382,"attracts":[],"care_level":null,"common_name":"rock rose","description":"Rock Rose (Helianthemum nummularium subsp. grandiflorum) is a low-growing, evergreen shrub found in dry, sunny places and rocky cliffs throughout Europe. The species can reach up to one meter in height with yellow, cup-shaped flowers with five oval petals, typical of the Cistaceae family. It is quite hardy and easy to maintain, as it can tolerate light shade and drought and is quite resistant to pests and diseases. It grows tall, up to 2 meters high, and has long, lance-shaped, rough leaves. Its common name is derived from the peppery smell the flowers exude when bruised. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3378,"attracts":["Birds"," Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"little sunflower","description":"The little sunflower (Helianthella quinquenervis) is a delightful alpine flower found in the western United States. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":3390,"attracts":["Birds"," Butterflies"],"care_level":null,"common_name":"ashy sunflower","description":"Ashy Sunflower (Helianthus mollis) is an attractive, informal daisy-like perennial with an irregular mound of narrow, gray-green foliage and single yellow flowers.
